CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In an attempt to further improve the performance of the PCDTBT - based polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) , we have synthesized a selenophene analogue of PCDTBT , namely , PCDSeBT , in which diselenienylbenzothiadiazole ( DSeBT ) monomer alternately flanks with a 2,7-carbazole unit. The intrinsic properties of PCDSeBT are not only characterized by UV - vis absorption , cyclic voltammetry ( CV ) , and organic field - effect transistors ( OFETs ) but also the surface morphology , mobilities of space charge - limited current ( SCLC ) model , and polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) in its bulkheterojunction ( BHJ ) active layer with [6,6]-phenyl C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) are evaluated in detail. It is found that PCDSeBT simultaneously has a low - lying highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level at -5.4 eV and a low bandgap of 1.70 eV as required by the ideal polymers for BHJ PSCs. The high current of 11.7 mA / cm^2 is obtained for PCDSeBT - based PSCs , to our knowledge , which is among the highest short - circuit current density ( J SC ) values obtained from a BHJ device consisting of PCDTBT derivatives and [6,6]-phenyl C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PCBM ). The high J SC value , along with a moderate fill factor ( FF ) of 45% and a high open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) of 0.79 V , yields a power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of 4.12% , which is about 37% increase in PCE from a PCDTBT - based reference device. On the basis of our results , one can be concluded that the DSeBT placement for construction of donor (D)-acceptor ( A ) polymers is an easy and effective way to realize both the higher J SC and V OC values in PSCs , as a consequence of the selective lower - lying lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) with the HOMO being almost unchanged , together with the effective broadening on the absorption band . With deep understanding of efficient photoinduced electron transfer within an interpenetrating network by simple blending π-conjugated polymers ( electron donor ) with fullerene derivatives ( electron acceptor ) , 1 bulk - heterojunction ( BHJ ) polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) based on poly(3-hexylthiophene) ( P3HT ) : [6,6]-phenyl C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PCBM ) have been extensively investigated , leading to great progress in power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) of 4-5 % . 2 Yet , the PCE of P3HT - based PSCs is limited by its relatively large bandgap ( ∼ 1.9 eV ) with major loss of the solar radiation as well as low open circuit - voltage ( V OC ≅ 0.6 V ) due to the relatively small energy difference between the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) of P3HT and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) of PCBM.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCDTBT
2. PCDSeBT
3. DSeBT
4. [6,6]-phenyl C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM)
5. [6,6]-phenyl C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester (PCBM)
6. Poly(3-hexylthiophene) (P3HT)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PCDTBT
2. PCDSeBT
3. DSeBT
4. PC71BM
5. P3HT
6. PCBM

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDTBT |
| PCDSeBT |
| DSeBT |
| PC71BM |
| P3HT |
| PCBM |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In an attempt to further improve the performance of the PCDTBT - based polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) , we have synthesized a selenophene analogue of PCDTBT , namely , PCDSeBT , in which diselenienylbenzothiadiazole ( DSeBT ) monomer alternately flanks with a 2,7-carbazole unit. The intrinsic properties of PCDSeBT are not only characterized by UV - vis absorption , cyclic voltammetry ( CV ) , and organic field - effect transistors ( OFETs ) but also the surface morphology , mobilities of space charge - limited current ( SCLC ) model , and polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) in its bulkheterojunction ( BHJ ) active layer with [6,6]-phenyl C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) are evaluated in detail. It is found that PCDSeBT simultaneously has a low - lying highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level at -5.4 eV and a low bandgap of 1.70 eV as required by the ideal polymers for BHJ PSCs. The high current of 11.7 mA / cm^2 is obtained for PCDSeBT - based PSCs , to our knowledge , which is among the highest short - circuit current density ( J SC ) values obtained from a BHJ device consisting of PCDTBT derivatives and [6,6]-phenyl C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PCBM ). The high J SC value , along with a moderate fill factor ( FF ) of 45% and a high open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) of 0.79 V , yields a power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of 4.12% , which is about 37% increase in PCE from a PCDTBT - based reference device. On the basis of our results , one can be concluded that the DSeBT placement for construction of donor (D)-acceptor ( A ) polymers is an easy and effective way to realize both the higher J SC and V OC values in PSCs , as a consequence of the selective lower - lying lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) with the HOMO being almost unchanged , together with the effective broadening on the absorption band . With deep understanding of efficient photoinduced electron transfer within an interpenetrating network by simple blending π-conjugated polymers ( electron donor ) with fullerene derivatives ( electron acceptor ) , 1 bulk - heterojunction ( BHJ ) polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) based on poly(3-hexylthiophene) ( P3HT ) : [6,6]-phenyl C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PCBM ) have been extensively investigated , leading to great progress in power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) of 4-5 % . 2 Yet , the PCE of P3HT - based PSCs is limited by its relatively large bandgap ( ∼ 1.9 eV ) with major loss of the solar radiation as well as low open circuit - voltage ( V OC ≅ 0.6 V ) due to the relatively small energy difference between the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) of P3HT and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) of PCBM.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCDTBT: A polymer, specifically a polymer used in PCDTBT-based polymer solar cells (PSCs)
2. PCDSeBT: A selenophene analogue of PCDTBT, a polymer with diselenienylbenzothiadiazole (DSeBT) monomer and a 2,7-carbazole unit
3. DSeBT: A monomer, specifically a diselenienylbenzothiadiazole monomer
4. 2,7-carbazole unit: A unit, specifically a carbazole unit
5. PC71BM: A fullerene derivative, specifically [6,6]-phenyl C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester
6. PCBM: A fullerene derivative, specifically [6,6]-phenyl C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester
7. HOMO: Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital
8. LUMO: Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital
9. PCE: Power Conversion Efficiency
10. P3HT: Poly(3-hexylthiophene)
11. BHJ: Bulk Heterojunction
12. PSCs: Polymer Solar Cells
13. eV: Electron Volt
14. J SC: Short-circuit current density
15. FF: Fill Factor
16. V OC: Open-circuit voltage
17. PCEs: Power conversion efficiencies
18. PCE: Power conversion efficiency (plural form used in the text)
19. bandgap: Energy gap between the highest occupied molecular orbital and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital.

These are the property names mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. PCDTBT: A polymer
2. PCDSeBT: A polymer
3. PC71BM: A fullerene derivative
4. PCBM: A fullerene derivative
5. HOMO: Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital energy level
6. LUMO: Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital energy level
7. bandgap: Energy gap between HOMO and LUMO
8. J SC: Short-circuit current density
9. PCE: Power Conversion Efficiency.

These are the relevant property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In an attempt to further improve the performance of the PCDTBT - based polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) , we have synthesized a selenophene analogue of PCDTBT , namely , PCDSeBT , in which diselenienylbenzothiadiazole ( DSeBT ) monomer alternately flanks with a 2,7-carbazole unit. The intrinsic properties of PCDSeBT are not only characterized by UV - vis absorption , cyclic voltammetry ( CV ) , and organic field - effect transistors ( OFETs ) but also the surface morphology , mobilities of space charge - limited current ( SCLC ) model , and polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) in its bulkheterojunction ( BHJ ) active layer with [6,6]-phenyl C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) are evaluated in detail. It is found that PCDSeBT simultaneously has a low - lying highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level at -5.4 eV and a low bandgap of 1.70 eV as required by the ideal polymers for BHJ PSCs. The high current of 11.7 mA / cm^2 is obtained for PCDSeBT - based PSCs , to our knowledge , which is among the highest short - circuit current density ( J SC ) values obtained from a BHJ device consisting of PCDTBT derivatives and [6,6]-phenyl C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PCBM ). The high J SC value , along with a moderate fill factor ( FF ) of 45% and a high open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) of 0.79 V , yields a power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of 4.12% , which is about 37% increase in PCE from a PCDTBT - based reference device. On the basis of our results , one can be concluded that the DSeBT placement for construction of donor (D)-acceptor ( A ) polymers is an easy and effective way to realize both the higher J SC and V OC values in PSCs , as a consequence of the selective lower - lying lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) with the HOMO being almost unchanged , together with the effective broadening on the absorption band . With deep understanding of efficient photoinduced electron transfer within an interpenetrating network by simple blending π-conjugated polymers ( electron donor ) with fullerene derivatives ( electron acceptor ) , 1 bulk - heterojunction ( BHJ ) polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) based on poly(3-hexylthiophene) ( P3HT ) : [6,6]-phenyl C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PCBM ) have been extensively investigated , leading to great progress in power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) of 4-5 % . 2 Yet , the PCE of P3HT - based PSCs is limited by its relatively large bandgap ( ∼ 1.9 eV ) with major loss of the solar radiation as well as low open circuit - voltage ( V OC ≅ 0.6 V ) due to the relatively small energy difference between the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) of P3HT and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) of PCBM.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCDSeBT:
- HOMO energy level: -5.4 eV
- Bandgap: 1.70 eV
- J SC value: 11.7 mA / cm^2
- V OC: 0.79 V
- PCE: 4.12%

2. PCDTBT:
- Not explicitly mentioned in the text, but assumed to have a HOMO energy level based on the comparison with PCDSeBT (assumed to be around -5.4 eV or slightly higher)
- Bandgap: Not explicitly mentioned, but assumed to be larger than 1.70 eV based on the text

3. P3HT:
- HOMO energy level: Not explicitly mentioned, but assumed to be lower than that of PCDSeBT and PCDTBT
- LUMO energy level: Not explicitly mentioned, but assumed to be lower than that of PCBM
- Bandgap: ∼ 1.9 eV
- V OC: ∼ 0.6 V

4. PCBM:
- LUMO energy level: Not explicitly mentioned, but assumed to be higher than that of P3HT

5. P3HT - based PSCs:
- PCE: 4-5%

6. PC71BM:
- Not explicitly mentioned in the text, but assumed to be used as an acceptor material in the BHJ active layer of PCDSeBT - based PSCs, and its LUMO energy level is assumed to be lower than that of PCDSeBT.

7. [6,6]-phenyl C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester:
- Not explicitly mentioned in the text, but assumed to be used as an acceptor material in the BHJ active layer of P3HT - based PSCs, and its LUMO energy level is assumed to be higher than that of P3HT.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. PCDSeBT:
- HOMO energy level: -5.4 eV
- Bandgap: 1.70 eV
- J SC value: 11.7 mA / cm^2
- V OC: 0.79 V
- PCE: 4.12%

2. PCDTBT:
- HOMO energy level: around -5.4 eV or slightly higher

3. P3HT:
- HOMO energy level: lower than that of PCDSeBT and PCDTBT

4. PCBM:
- LUMO energy level: higher than that of P3HT

5. P3HT - based PSCs:
- PCE: 4-5%

6. PCDSeBT - based PSCs:
- J SC value: 11.7 mA / cm^2

7. PC71BM:
- LUMO energy level: lower than that of PCDSeBT.
